column4: The desktop background of my brothers computer just whent black, all icons gone... menues and bars are left... he can switch between the sides of the compiz cube...
rebooting doesnt help...
nautilus crashed, opening a new nautilus window (select anything from the places menu) should fix it
ill call and tell him that!
hmm... the window opened but the background is still black and no icons...
hmm.. does he get a menu when he right-clicks the desktop?
nope
tell him to try running nautilus from the command line
that opened a file browser... nothing else
maybe he somehow configured nautilus to to manage the desktop, let me search where is that configured, also, maybe he tried using some kind of an automatic wallpaper setting application?
thanks! (he didnt use any wallpaper app)
run gconf-editor from the command line, go into appd->nautilus->preferences and make sure "show_desktop" is checked
run gconf-editor from the command line, go into apps->nautilus->preferences and make sure "show_desktop" is checked
that was already checked
hmm... lest try brute force... run "xkill" click on the desktop then run "sudo killall nautilus" from the command line then try running nautilus again
'xkill' from the terminal?
yeah
of all that doesn't work, try turning off desktop effects
'sudo killall nautilus' made everything come back, no need to restart nautilus... now what? :) problem solved?
seems so, make sure it stays ok after reboot
great! rebooting! any idea what might have caused this and how to avoid it?
some nautilus glitch. no idea
everything is OK! many thanks! :)
